baseline_groups.claim_summary: Screen-time bonus and limit treatments reduce daily phone usage (FITSBY apps) among Android users in an RCT
baseline_groups.notes: RCT with two orthogonal treatments (Bonus B and Limit L). Rows 001-002 are both labeled 'baseline' but report different focal treatments (B and L respectively) for the primary P2 FITSBY usage outcome. Rows 003-008 are additional baseline outcome/period variants. HC1 robust SEs are canonical for G1.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Screen-time limit treatment improves self-reported well-being outcomes in stacked survey panel (S3/S4)
baseline_groups.notes: Stacked panel (survey waves S3, S4) with individual clustering. Focal treatment is L (limit). Multiple well-being outcome measures. Cluster(UserID) SEs are canonical for G2.

global_notes: Surface-driven run with two baseline groups. Both groups match the pre-run surface plan. G1 has 38 rows (8 baselines + 21 RC for B treatment + 9 additional RC for L treatment). G2 has 16 rows (6 baselines + 10 RC for L treatment). Duplicate spec_ids (e.g., 'baseline') across groups and within G1 (B vs L focal treatment) are differentiated by spec_run_id and treatment_var. This is acceptable for an RCT with two orthogonal treatments.
